page.title: 11INDUSTRY - FARMING
page.content:
In this area of 12 square kilometres, there are no fewer than 10 active and separate farming units. Some are devoted to exclusive production of milk and dairy products, some exclusively to the production of grain and cereal crops. No farms in the area are exclusively given to sheep rearing, but many run sizeable flocks. There is some beef cattle production, and some farms have the usual assortment of pigs, hens, ducks, etc.
All farms are highly mechanised. One of our team wrote "Most tractors have got pick-up hitches, and three point pick-up linkage. My dad's tractor is a Ford TW25 164HP, and is 4Wheel Drive. 4WD is very useful in slick conditions, and for silageing it stops you from running away with full loads."
